CHANG-NING(7) Miscellaneous Information Manual CHANG-NING(7)

NAME

Chang-Ning Tsai - a code farmer

SYNOPSIS

chang-ning [--languages] [--skills] [--projects] [--contributor] [work-experience] [--talks]

DESCRIPTION

I started my formal code farmer career in 2015 when I served for Research and Development Substitute Services in Taiwan. It was my first time to dabble large scale open sources such as Samba, Netatalk, Avahi, and so on. I enjoy learn from open sources and appreciate they help me horn my programming skills.

OPTIONS

--languages
python
Python is one of my favoriate languages because of its elegant syntax. When I served at Synology Inc., I used Python to write many autotest scripts and implement a continuous integration system.
c/c++
I have used C/C++ for 10 years. However, I am still learning these language because new language features (e.g. C++17) are evolving extremely fast recently In addition, to better use C/C++, learning related tools such as cmake, GNU autotools, or LLVM is necessary. Therefore, I can not guarantee that I master C/C++, but developing projects through C/C++ will not be a serious problem.
javascript
It is inevitable to use Javascript to develop web applications.
bash
It is inevitable to write a bash script.
--skills
network protocols
docker/kubernetes
aws
ci/cd
--work-experience
Synology Product Developer / Taipei, Taiwan / 2015-2018
LeaderG Mobile Developer / Taipei, Taiwan / 2013-2014
--contributor
* flask-seasurf
* blessed-contrib
--projects

--talks

How to use coroutine to build a socket server?
